Sequence Information.Source: database-based sequence extension, library screen, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 85.71% similar toPAF26. W=K: 29%, F=R=Y: 14%.Activity: active against P. digitatum PHI-26 (MIC 8 uM), P. italicum PHI-1  (MIC 4 uM), P. expansum PHI-65 (MIC 8 uM), Alternaria sp. PHI-44 (MIC 16 uM), A. nidulans biA1 (MIC 8 uM), B. cinerea #8 (MIC 8 uM), F. oxysporum CECT2866 (MIC 8 uM), M-grisea PR-9 (MIC >32 uM), E. coli DH5alpha (MIC 16 uM), B. subtilis CECT498 (MIC 8 uM), and S. cerevisiae FY1679 (MIC 32 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Muñoz A, López-García B, Pérez-Payá E, Marcos JF.2007
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2007 Mar 2;354(1):172-7. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2006.12.173.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial properties of derivatives of the cationic tryptophan-rich hexapeptide PAF26
